item.title: Tips for an active classroom
item.description: Many instructors believe that learning is enhanced in a classroom where students are active participants rather than the passive recipients of a lecture. This document describes some general techniques for fostering an active classroom that can be used in a wide range of lesson topics. (There are also tips for specific topics included in the instructor guide for each topic.) Whatâ€™s key is to constantly look for opportunities to force students to make a choice, offer a suggestion, or state an interpretation or an opinion.
